text: Coedydd Dyffryn Alwen is a Site of Special Scientific Interest in the preserved county of Clwyd, north Wales. It contains a mix of different woodland types, reflecting the underlying geology and soil type, including ash, oak and rowan, with a hazel understorey, with a rich ground flora including globe flower, oak and beech fern.https://naturalresources.wales/media/682564/nlca10-denbigh-moors- description.pdf ==See also== *List of Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Clwyd ==References== Category:Sites of Special Scientific Interest in Clwyd
title: Coedydd Dyffryn Alwen
